data.text:
Dallas, TX, the US

Latitude and longitude coordinates are: 32.779167, -96.808891.

Dallas, the seat of Dallas County, is a large city located in north Texas, the southern US. It is the third-largest city in the state, as well as one of the ten most populous cities in the country. Dallas is a modern city and a center of business, economy, social life, culture, education, and other aspects of life. Dallas is a heavily industrialized area, with a large number of plants and factories working in various industrial fields. It is also a center of services, science, and IT. The local arts and culture are heavily influenced by Mexican culture, with a large number of Mexican and other Hispanic people living in the city. The city is home to UT Southwestern Medical Center, Texas Woman's University, The University of North Texas at Dallas, Southern Methodist University, The University of Texas at Dallas, etc. In addition, Dallas/Fort Worth International Airport that serves the Dallasâ€“Fort Worth metroplex area, is one of the busiest airports in the world.

Dallas is an extremely popular tourist spot, with plenty of cultural events, landmarks, and tourist attractions, great restaurants, hotels, plenty of things to see and do. Among the places you can visit are Dallas Arboretum and Botanical Garden, First Baptist Church Dallas, Cathedral Santuario de la Virgen de Guadalupe, Saint Seraphim Cathedral, Galleria Dallas, Perot Museum of Nature and Science, The Winspear Opera House, the Dallas Museum of Art, Dallas Center for the Performing Arts, the Meadows Museum, African American Museum, Arts District, Bishop Arts District, Klyde Warren Park, Fair Park, Hall of State Building, Dallas Holocaust Museum/Center for Education & Tolerance, Majestic Theatre, Victory Park, White Rock Lake, Lake Cliff Park, Dallas Municipal Building, Margaret Hunt Hill Bridge, Katy Trail, AT&T Stadium, the Old Red Museum, and many more.
